Articles.Content:
I have been having weird flickering shadows on my crafts since I updated to 1.1. I have been trying to find an answer, however it is possible there is a technical name for my problem and I just wasn't searching for the right thing. I'm running KSP v1.1.0.1230 on 64bit Windows 7 Home Premium. I have 16gb of ram, an Intel Core i7-3820 CPU with a NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 graphics card. I run the game through steam.

Thinking it may have been a mod or install problem I deleted local content via steam then went into the hard disk and removed any remaining KSP files. Then reinstalled it and the problem persisted. It is also present when I select the default launch option or the 64bit. 

In the picture the areas where it looks like a traingle is missing from the shadows move from the bottom to the top and keep looping. Thanks so much for the help. Sorry if I did not do something right. This is my first time posting, but I am trying my best to follow the please read as I write this up.

Picture:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/23su9piptchz11i/Shadow%20Flicker.jpg?dl=0

 

Output Log:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/qwl2tg901vpqx1u/output_log.txt?dl=0

I've noticed this as well.  Weird scrolling, saw-tooth shadows.

clean install v 1.1 GOG version

No mods

Windows 10 64-bit

intel i5-4690

8 GB RAM

AMD Radeon r9 280 3 GB

There are LOTS of known shadow glitches in 1.1. Just go to the pre release branch sub forum and search "shadows"

Or the bug tracker and search "shadow" http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=shadow

Edited April 25, 2016 by JPLRepo

So far I'm liking the improved visual fidelity and performance of 1.1.2, except for THIS!  It's pretty distracting and significantly lessening my enjoyment of looking at the game, it's just that bad.

https://vid.me/tzoW

How come the shadow cascades slider went up to 64 in <=1.0.5 and only up to 4 in >=1.1?

It's weird how the speed of shadow-crawl changes when you change the camera angle...

KSP x64 build id = 01260 2016.04.30 at 12:23:12 CEST Branch: master
Unmodded, full .zip install from the KSP store.
Windows 7 64-bit, Intel i5, NVIDIA NVS 5400M
(sadly, dxdiag only detects the Intel integrated GPU even when I tell dxdiag.exe to explicitly run on the NVIDIA chip.  KSP is definitely running on the NVIDIA.)
Only in 1.1? I've never not had this same shadow glitch. Seriously, I think you just never noticed it.

On 4/25/2016 at 4:16 PM, JPLRepo said:

There are LOTS of known shadow glitches in 1.1. Just go to the pre release branch sub forum and search "shadows"

Or the bug tracker and search "shadow" http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=shadow

I've been looking for a while now, still haven't found this shadow bug on the bug tracker.
